The issue with `ApiSurfaceTest` seems to be that 1.14 has added new, optional compile-time dependencies (such as brotli) that are causing ClassLoader errors when iterating over the binary classes in SDK-java-core.
Thanks for merging @dhalperi I was AFK most of the day but expected to do it later on.

@ssisk , @iemejia if the general opinion is that it is an overkill to add a complete code example for Hive / HCatalog with HIFIO, I think we should go with the PR https://github.com/apache/beam-site/pull/249 which adds a snippet to beam-site for Hive with HIFIO. WDYT ?
@dhalperi Yes. But but unfortunately i have no idea, how that should/could be fixed :(

`Connect to conjars.org:80 [conjars.org/107.22.169.25] failed: Connection timed out`

retest this please

@seshadri-cr I think effectively that we cant expect to have any existing implementation of HIFIO to be included in the examples, however I would like to have a clear criteria to decide what implementations should be included as examples, for that reason I opened the discussion in the mailing list. IMO we should only have as examples the implementations of HIF that don't exist as native IOs, so once the native implementation is there they shouldn't be there (e.g. I would expect that both of the current examples get removed once we have their native implemationts (e.g. Elasticsearch 5 and Cassandra).
The problem with having this PR only as documentation (e.g. in the website) is that APIs can change, and the code in the website can become outdated, at least we will discover this by having the implementation in the repo. But well since you have the other PR for the native implementation, maybe it makes sense to close this one in favor of the beam-site one.

R: @jbonofre 

If LGTY can you test manually and merge? Jenkins seems broken right now so have to do it manually.
Thanks ! Let me review and test locally.

LGTM
@jasonkuster Did you want to review this as well?

I've done local `mvn clean install` to refresh myself, and the SDF matchers are not properly in place.
@iemejia thanks for letting me know that group into batches doesn't work on all runners. That's disappointing.

In topological order, this PR adds additional translation support for each requisite transform, then adds adequate `PTransformMatchers` that leverage the new support, then alters the `DirectRunner` to use them.
Locations of various methods and fields TBD and I'm happy to oblige suggestions.
The jenkins failure is not flaky, it's an issue spotted by `findbugs`.
@jkff the most recent failure yes. Previously it was failing with strange jenkins errors.

All updated as comments.

not complete, will update a note when all comments are addressed.
I don't see how the failure in org.apache.beam.sdk.io.jms.JmsIOTest.testAuthenticationWithBadPassword could be related to this PR.
@reuvenlax if you take a look on the result in this PR, I don't think it's the latest build due to the issue we have currently between Jenkins and GitHub. Let me try and trigger a build by hand.
Yes, I ran a simple WordCountByStatefulParDo on the YARN cluster.

@jkff, regret the indentation issues on the pom file. There seems to be some mess-up, I find that these files are actually indented properly in my local git however when I committed these changes they did not reflect in my fork (which I did not realize until your comments). I would correct this and double check before I get this for review.

Also I have a few questions that would help me addressing the major comments :

**1. Use of BoundedSource -**
   I was looking into some more details on the aspect of splits and stumbled across this - https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/Hive/HCatalog+Configuration+Properties. There seems to be a way to indicate HCatalog a 'desired' number of splits using the config parameter - 'hcat.desired.partition.num.splits'. However this is used as an 'hint' by HCatalog and does not guarantee that the exact number of desired splits will be achieved. Though this is a best-effort approach, does it make sense to implement this split logic and consider keeping it as a BoundedSource as this is the best attempt to get the desired number of splits. Else I can break this up as DoFns as you suggested.
Please let me know your thoughts on this.

**2. Lot of config for embedded Hive source**
  I completely agree with your comments and in fact felt the same way myself too. This is the only suitable  embedded Hive source that was available for the specific use-case. There are two config files in total viz. hive-site.xml and hive-log4j2.properties. I guess the log4j props can be removed however hive-site.xml contains the config params required to bring up the embedded Hive server, I will try to see if there is an alternate for this. In case if I do not find an alternate, it might have to stay on. @iemejia , please let me know if you have any pointers to avoid the usage of hive-site.xml

**3. Rest of the comments**
I agree with rest of your comments, I will address them as specified.

Appreciate all your efforts in reviewing this, being my first contribution here I am learning a lot from you folks and thankful for all your guidance and support in making this work !

Maybe we say that the class-level `@Experimental` is good enough, but it isn't on any of the builders or the inner class.

To fix the breaking change, should we decide to do so...

I would suggest re-adding the old builds as `@Deprecated` methods. You'll have to statically reference the "new" SerializableConfiguration via full classpath. Add `@Deprecated` to the `SerializableConfiguration` in HIFIO and then also make sure you test both deprecated and non-deprecated paths in unit tests (`@SuppressWarnings("deprecation")`).

(software is hard :).

Dan, not sure if I follow but this seems terribly complex for what it brings to the table, no?

I agree that the stable contract is super important and we need to respect it but this is a 'leaky/special case' as is the case also for other publicly exposed inner classes of still Experimental parent classes (I suppose we should have a good chunk like this).

For example think about KafkaIO that is Experimental, imagine that we need to change the Read class to rename a method, for me this is not a breaking change considering the parent class is Experimental, however Read is publicly exposed and not marked as Experimental, so applying the current logic that would mean that we can't evolve it, invalidating the whole goal of marking things Experimental.

I think what we need is to define Experimental as an 'inheritable' property to inner classes even at least from a conceptual point of view because the SDK does not enforce this. WDYT?
Do you have a link to the failed integration tests?
@peihe Could you please rebase now that #3258 is in?
The other option would be to mark manually Experimental all the public inner classes of the parent Experimental classes, but that also seems a bit overkill. :S
